triples.name: Linear temporal logic
triples.relevance: LTL specifications are used to express the complex temporal properties that the synthesized control policies must satisfy.

triples.name: Stochastic control
triples.relevance: The paper addresses synthesis for discrete-time stochastic control systems with probabilistic guarantees.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: The foundational field providing control design principles and controller synthesis methods.

triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: The approach decomposes specifications into simpler reachability tasks to be solved systematically.

triples.name: Automata theory
triples.relevance: Automata representation is used to decompose the given LTL specification into reachability subtasks.

triples.name: Kinematics
triples.relevance: The lane-keeping application uses a four-dimensional single-track kinematic model of vehicle dynamics.

triples.name: Automated Lane Keeping Systems
triples.relevance: Lane-keeping control of a vehicle is one of the experimental applications demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed approach.

triples.name: Temperature control
triples.relevance: Room temperature control is one of the experimental applications used to validate the proposed synthesis method.

triples.name: Control barrier certificate
triples.relevance: The paper proposes the novel use of control barrier certificates as the primary technique for solving reachability tasks with probability bounds.
